info.title: mGBA-http
info.description: An HTTP interface for mGBA scripting.

post.summary: Adds a single button.
post.description: A custom convenience API that mimics /core/addkey but uses button names as opposed to a bitmask.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Key value of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

post.summary: Adds multiple buttons.
post.description: A custom convenience API that mimics /core/addkeys but uses button names as opposed to their number value.

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: Key values of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

post.summary: Remove a single button.
post.description: A custom convenience API that mimics /core/clearkey but uses button names as opposed to their number value.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Key value of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

post.summary: Remove multiple buttons.
post.description: A custom convenience API that mimics /core/clearkeys but uses button names as opposed to a bitmask.

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: Key values of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

get.summary: Get the active state of a given button.
get.description: A custom convenience API that mimics /core/getkey but uses button names as opposed to their number value.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Button value of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

200.description: 0 if key is not pressed or 1 if the key is pressed.

get.summary: Gets all active buttons.
get.description: A custom convenience API that gets all active buttons.

200.description: Comma separated string with all active keys

post.summary: Sends button presses.
post.description: A custom convenience API that implements a key press and release. This is as opposed to the key based core API that sends only either a press or release message.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Key value of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

post.summary: Sends multiple button presses simultaneously.
post.description: A custom convenience API that implements multiple simultaneously keys being pressed and released. This is as opposed to the key based core API that sends only either a press or release message.

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: A key array.

post.summary: Sends a held down button for a given duration in frames.
post.description: A custom convenience API that implements a held down button for a given duration in frames. This is as opposed to the key based core API that sends only either a press or release message.

parameters.name: button
parameters.description: Key value of: A, B, Start, Select, Start, Right, Left, Up, Down, R, or L.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration in frames.

post.summary: Sends multiple button presses simultaneously for a given duration in frames.
post.description: A custom convenience API that implements multiple simultaneously keys being pressed and released for a given duration in frames. This is as opposed to the key based core API that sends only either a press or release message.

parameters.name: buttons
parameters.description: A key array.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Duration in frames.

post.summary: Print an error to the console.
post.description: Print an error to the console. This will be shown as red text on light red background.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The error message to display in console.

post.summary: Print a log to the console.
post.description: Print a log to the console. This will be shown as regular text.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The log message to display in console.

post.summary: Print a warning to the console.
post.description: Print a warning to the console. This will be shown as yellow text on light yellow background.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The warning message to display in console.

post.summary: Add a single key.
post.description: Add a single key to the currently active key list. As if the key were held down.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key value of: 0-9

post.summary: Add a bitmask of keys.
post.description: Add a bitmask of keys to the currently active key list. As if the keys were held down.

parameters.name: keyBitmask
parameters.description: The bitmask of keys to add. Bitmasking has the keys from the mGBA scripting documentation where each key has a value that goes up in that order in binary: A = 1, B = 2, Select = 4, Start = 8, etc. A bitmask of 12 is Start and Select.

post.summary: Load save data.
post.description: Load the save data associated with the currently loaded ROM file.

get.summary: Get the checksum of the loaded ROM.
get.description: Get the checksum of the loaded ROM.

post.summary: Remove a single key.
post.description: Remove a single key from the currently active key list. As if the key were released.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key value of: 0-9

post.summary: Remove a bitmask of keys.
post.description: Remove a bitmask of keys from the currently active key list. As if the keys were released.

parameters.name: keyBitmask
parameters.description: The bitmask of keys to clear. Bitmasking has the keys from the mGBA scripting documentation where each key has a value that goes up in that order in binary: A = 1, B = 2, Select = 4, Start = 8, etc. A bitmask of 12 is Start and Select.

get.summary: Get the number of the current frame.
get.description: Get the number of the current frame.

get.summary: Get the number of cycles per frame.
get.description: Get the number of cycles per frame.

get.summary: Get the number of cycles per second.
get.description: Get the number of cycles per second.

get.summary: Get internal product code for the game.
get.description: Get internal product code for the game from the ROM header, if available.

get.summary: Get internal title of the game.
get.description: Get internal title of the game from the ROM header.

get.summary: Get the active state of a given key.
get.description: Get the active state of a given key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Key value of: 0-9

200.description: 0 if key is not pressed or 1 if the key is pressed.

get.summary: Get the currently active keys as a bitmask.
get.description: Get the currently active keys as a bitmask.

200.description: Bitmask string representing currently active keys.

post.summary: Load a ROM file.
post.description: Load a ROM file into the current state of this core. **Note: Prefer using the /mgba-http/extension/loadfile endpoint.**

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to ROM file to load.

post.summary: Load save data file.
post.description: Load save data from the given path. If the temporary flag is set, the given save data will not be written back to disk.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to save file to load.

parameters.name: temporary
parameters.description: If true, save data will not be written back to disk.

post.summary: Load state from a buffer.
post.description: Load state from a hex array string buffer in the format: [d3,00,ea,66,...].

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 29 excludes screenshot flag (all except SCREENSHOT). Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

requestBody.description: State buffer data as hex array string format: [d3,00,ea,66,...]

post.summary: Load state from the given path.
post.description: Load state from the given path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to state file to load.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 29 excludes screenshot flag. Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

post.summary: Load state from the slot number.
post.description: Load state from the slot number.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: State slot number to load from.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 29 excludes screenshot flag. Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

get.summary: Get which platform is being emulated.
get.description: Get which platform is being emulated.

get.summary: Read a 16-bit value from the given bus address.
get.description: Read a 16-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

get.summary: Read a 32-bit value from the given bus address.
get.description: Read a 32-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

get.summary: Read an 8-bit value from the given bus address.
get.description: Read an 8-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

get.summary: Read byte range from the given offset.
get.description: Read byte range from the given offset.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bytes to read.

200.description: Comma separated hex values of the read memory.

get.summary: Read the value of the register with the given name.
get.description: Read the value of the register with the given name.

parameters.name: regName
parameters.description: Register name to read (e.g., 'r0', 'r1', 'sp', 'lr', 'pc').

get.summary: Get the size of the loaded ROM.
get.description: Get the size of the loaded ROM.

post.summary: Save state and return as a buffer.
post.description: Save state and return as a buffer. This can be used with /core/loadstatebuffer to restore state.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 31 includes all flags (screenshot, metadata, etc). Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

post.summary: Save state to the given path.
post.description: Save state to the given path.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path where state file will be saved.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 31 includes all flags. Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

post.summary: Save state to the slot number.
post.description: Save state to the slot number.

parameters.name: slot
parameters.description: State slot number to save to.

parameters.name: flags
parameters.description: State flags bitmask. Default 31 includes all flags. Flags: SCREENSHOT=1, SAVEDATA=2, CHEATS=4, RTC=8, METADATA=16.

post.summary: Save a screenshot.
post.description: Save a screenshot.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: For example, C:\screenshots\screenshot.png

post.summary: Set the currently active key list.
post.description: Set the currently active key list.

parameters.name: keys
parameters.description: The bitmask of keys to set as active. Bitmasking has the keys from the mGBA scripting documentation where each key has a value that goes up in that order in binary: A = 1, B = 2, Select = 4, Start = 8, etc. A bitmask of 12 is Start and Select.

post.summary: Run a single instruction.
post.description: Run a single instruction.

post.summary: Write a 16-bit value from the given bus address.
post.description: Write a 16-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in hex, e.g. 0x0300

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 16-bit decimal value to write (0-65535).

post.summary: Write a 32-bit value from the given bus address.
post.description: Write a 32-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in hex, e.g. 0x0300

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 32-bit decimal value to write.

post.summary: Write an 8-bit value from the given bus address.
post.description: Write an 8-bit value from the given bus address.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address in hex, e.g. 0x0300

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 8-bit decimal value to write (0-255).

post.summary: Write the value of the register with the given name.
post.description: Write the value of the register with the given name.

parameters.name: regName
parameters.description: Register name to write (e.g., 'r0', 'r1', 'sp', 'lr', 'pc', etc).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: Decimal value to write to the register.

post.summary: Reset the emulation.
post.description: Reset the emulation and calls the reset callback.

get.summary: Get the platform specific set of memory domains.
get.description: Get the platform specific set of memory domains.

200.description: The memory domains as a comma separated string.

post.summary: Load a ROM file.
post.description: Load a ROM file into the current state of this core. This convenience API handles the ROM load and reset of the emulator.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to ROM file to load.

get.summary: Get the base address of the memory domain.
get.description: Get the base address of the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

200.description: Address of the base of this memory domain.

get.summary: Get the bound of the memory domain.
get.description: Get the address of the end bound of this memory domain. Note that this address is not in the domain itself, and is the address of the first byte past it.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

get.summary: Get the name of the memory domain.
get.description: Get a short, human-readable name for this memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

get.summary: Read a 16-bit value from the given offset.
get.description: Read a 16-bit value from the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300')

get.summary: Read a 32-bit value from the given offset.
get.description: Read a 32-bit value from the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300')

get.summary: Read an 8-bit value from the given offset.
get.description: Read an 8-bit value from the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300')

get.summary: Read byte range from the given offset.
get.description: Read byte range from the given offset.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string (e.g., '0x0300').

parameters.name: length
parameters.description: Number of bytes to read.

get.summary: Get the size of the memory domain.
get.description: Get the size of this memory domain in bytes.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

200.description: Size in bytes as a string.

post.summary: Write a 16-bit value to the given offset.
post.description: Write a 16-bit value to the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 16-bit decimal value to write (0-65535). Not hex.

post.summary: Write a 32-bit value to the given offset.
post.description: Write a 32-bit value to the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 32-bit decimal value to write. Not hex.

post.summary: Write an 8-bit value to the given offset.
post.description: Write an 8-bit value to the given offset in the specified memory domain.

parameters.name: memoryDomain
parameters.description: Memory domain name (e.g., 'wram', 'cart0', 'bios', etc).

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address as hex string with 0x prefix (e.g., '0x0300').

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: 8-bit decimal value to write (0-255). Not hex.
